conclusion: The refractive index of light is higher when the concentration of sucrose water is higher, as it affects the way light interacts with the glass.
The image shows two identical thin-walled glasses, A and B, with different concentrations of sucrose water. Light is incident at the same angle θ on both glasses. The refraction angle β1 > β2.
Since β1 > β2, the light travels further in glass A than in glass B.
This implies that the concentration of sucrose water in glass A is greater than in glass B.
The concentration of sucrose water in cup A is higher.
